meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sparse.
meanings.sent1: The sparsities of trees in the desert made it difficult to find shade.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the sparsities of decorations in the room, giving it a minimalist feel.
meanings.sent3: The sparsities of toppings on the pizza made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His sparsities in conversation made him a mysterious figure.
meanings.sent5: The sparsities of stars in the sky created a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: A small amount or number; scarcity.
meanings.sent1: The sparsities of food in the pantry forced her to get creative with meals.
meanings.sent2: He was used to the sparsities of customers during weekdays at the store.
meanings.sent3: The sparsities of jokes at the party made everyone appreciate the few that were shared.
meanings.sent4: In the sparsities of time, she found moments of true happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sparsities of flowers in the garden made each bloom even more precious.
